item.title: Large items, building waste, domestic rubbish bags, 2nd September
item.description:
A popular dumping spot for fly tipping. Rubbish and large waste building up again. Rusty garden table has been there a couple of months, along with rusty incinerator and partially burnt garden waste, general rubbish bags, and a wheelie bin full of building waste was dumped 1 week ago.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Chipstead Close, Crystal Palace, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Removal of ebike parking major issue for those living south of Brixton, 2nd September
item.description:
The ebike parking bay outside Brixton train station has been removed. For those coming from large parts of south London (poorly served by public transport) this is the main safe cycle route to Brixton tube station. Now anyone coming from that direction has to cross the main road twice to access a parking bay, then again to get to the tube station. That area had a large amount of pavement space, so not sure why ebike parking has been ended there - but there must be a parking space on the B223 near the tube station that could be repurposed for ebike parking? The current situation is a huge inconvenience for people coming from further south when our transport options are already poor!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Atlantic Road, Brixton, London
Report on FixMyStreet
